slots.name: icon:value
slots.description: Icons for the selected Dropdown Option(s). Slot one icon per Dropdown Option. \`<value>\` should be equal to the \`value\` of each Dropdown Option.

type.text: Checkbox | CheckboxGroup | Dropdown | Input | RadioGroup | Slider | TextArea

slots.name: prefix-icon
slots.description: An icon before the input field

slots.name: suffix-icon
slots.description: An icon after the input field

members.name: passwordToggle
members.description: For 'password' type, whether to show a button to toggle the password's visibility

attributes.name: password-toggle
attributes.description: For 'password' type, whether to show a button to toggle the password's visibility

slots.name: control
slots.description: The element with which the label is associated

slots.name: target
slots.description: The element to which Menu will anchor. Can be any focusable element unless it's the target of a sub-Menu, in which case the element shouldn't be focusable. If you want Menu to be filterable, put an Input in this slot. Listen for Input's "input" event, then add and remove Option(s) from Menu's default slot based on Input's value.

members.name: placement
members.description:
Menu will try to move itself to the opposite of this value if not doing so would result in overflow.
For example, if "bottom" results in overflow Menu will try "top" but not "right" or "left".

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
Menu will try to move itself to the opposite of this value if not doing so would result in overflow.
For example, if "bottom" results in overflow Menu will try "top" but not "right" or "left".

slots.name: content
slots.description: This is the unhappy path. It's the escape hatch where you can render arbitrary content and lay it out however you need to. If you go this route, \`slot="icon"\` and \`slot="submenu"\` will become unavailable. And the \`label\` and \`description\` attributes won't be rendered. The \`label\` attribute is still required. We'll show it in a tooltip when your content overflows. If you need a second line of text in the tooltip, provide you can provide it via the \`description\` attribute.

slots.name: target
slots.description: The element to which Popover will anchor. Can be any focusable element.

members.name: placement
members.description:
Popover will try to move itself to the opposite of this value if not doing so would result in overflow.
For example, if "bottom" results in overflow Popover will try "top" but not "right" or "left".

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
Popover will try to move itself to the opposite of this value if not doing so would result in overflow.
For example, if "bottom" results in overflow Popover will try "top" but not "right" or "left".

slots.name: target
slots.description: The element to which Select will anchor. Can be any focusable element. If you want Select to be filterable, put an Input in this slot. Listen for Input's "input" event, then add and remove Option(s) from Select's default slot based on Input's value.

members.name: placement
members.description:
Select will try to move itself to the opposite of this value if not doing so would result in overflow.
For example, if "bottom" results in overflow Menu will try "top" but not "right" or "left".

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
Select will try to move itself to the opposite of this value if not doing so would result in overflow.
For example, if "bottom" results in overflow Menu will try "top" but not "right" or "left".

members.name: name
members.description: The corresponding Tab should have a `panel` attribute with this name.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The corresponding Tab should have a `panel` attribute with this name.

members.name: duration
members.description: Set to `Infinity` to make it persist until dismissed by the user

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description: Set to `Infinity` to make it persist until dismissed by the user

slots.name: target
slots.description: The element to which Tooltip will anchor. Can be any interactive element with an implicit or explicit ARIA role.

members.name: placement
members.description:
Tooltip will try to move itself to the opposite of this value if not doing so would result in overflow.
For example, if "bottom" results in overflow Tooltip will try "top" but not "right" or "left".

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
Tooltip will try to move itself to the opposite of this value if not doing so would result in overflow.
For example, if "bottom" results in overflow Tooltip will try "top" but not "right" or "left".
